thread.title: ROUNDUP: Conquerors, Eagles roll to easy gridiron wins
thread.title_full: ROUNDUP: Conquerors, Eagles roll to easy gridiron wins

title: ROUNDUP: Conquerors, Eagles roll to easy gridiron wins
text:
ROUNDUP: Conquerors, Eagles roll to easy gridiron wins Staff reports 10:38 p.m. PDT October 16, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Desert Christian Academy dodged the rain drops and the Palm Valley defenders for an easy victory Friday night. 
The Conquerors opened up a 56-0 lead with three minutes to go before the half. The game was delayed by lightning and the decision was made not to continue. Desert Christian was declared the winner. 
Wyatt Snellenberger was 7 for 10 for 180 yards and five touchdowns. Kenny Gagnon had five receptions for 163 yards and four touchdowns. Cade Burt had seven carries for 104 yards and two touchdowns. 
Desert Christian Academy (5-3) has a tough one next week, when they play at No. 1 Joshua Springs on Friday. 
Desert Chapel 68, Cornerstone Christian 6: The defense did the trick for the Eagles as they had an interception returned for a touchdown by Ethan Sarmkas and a blocked punt returned for a touchdown by Aaron Corey. James Cain added two interceptions. 
Kaleb Whan had two rushing touchdowns and Skarmas had “several” rushing scores. 
“We did some good things out there and it felt good to get the win,” coach Jim Donaldson said. “But, we know we have a lot to improve on and we’re going to have work at improving and getting better every week.” 
The Eagles host Palm Valley on Friday. 
Boys’ water polo 
La Quinta 14, Xavier Prep 2: In a game delayed by lightning, the Blackhawks ran away with another DVL win, staying unbeaten in league play. 
Justin Hop and Brayden Smith led the scoring for La Quinta with four goals each. Miles Tarsitano and Will Alwine each scored twice and Todd Becker and Spencer Lowell each scored once. 
La Quinta is 14-3 overall and 6-0 in the DVL. Read or Share this story: http://desert.sn/1Lz5URj TOP VIDEOS
